item.title: 20220823172238-oneliners
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ How was it possible for someone to breathe in air and breathe out poetry?

item.title: A haiku about Mondays
item.description: OR: some old poetry i wrote when I was young Monday is busy People walking fast the street To be productive

item.title: A Poem for Humanities
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young (literally a school requirement) $~$ Back then four years ago, when I had a project

item.title: bewitched
item.description: your laugh sounds like a purple lilac swaying to the gush of the wind holding my attention captive your smell is an elixir

item.title: chords
item.description: i strummed the guitar, strings vibrating with the sound of the sea but all that’s in my head is your fingers doing the chord of G

item.title: Cupcake and peas
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young (i wrote this for an elementary paper pretending I was a first grade kid lol)

item.title: Dearest
item.description: Dearest, Do you, my beloved, have a slight inkling of how you remoulded this existence of mine many would call a life?

item.title: front row seat
item.description: then i’m drunk and you’re not and i got the front-row seat seeing people flirt with you, stare at you

item.title: gorgeous
item.description: a poetry book also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$

item.title: i heard your voice
item.description: i died your voice is both halcyon and forlorn it felt like sweet liquid trickling down a honeysuckle bud the greatest aphrodisiac in the most innocent way

item.title: i know you and i don't
item.description: okay maybe i stay a little too late at night stalking your profile or maybe i stare at you a little too long than what’s normal

item.title: i'd do it
item.description: i realized i’d do anything for you you could ask me to jump and i’d ask how high also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young

item.title: in too deep
item.description: there’s this feeling creeping through my insides from my stomach working its way to my heart those secret glances i throw hoping you wouldn’t notice

item.title: infatuated
item.description: i told myself it was only an infatuation but then i started to hear your voice in my favourite songs

item.title: Meteorite
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ Careless whispers surround the night Stars twinkle under the foggy twilight

item.title: never enough
item.description: white pages painted with black ink of words i’m trying to use skimming dictionaries, thesauri and all of those word books

item.title: nineteen twenty-five
recipe for disaster
item.description: be a girl, like a straight girl from a distance, look at her sit beside her, laugh. be her friend

item.title: saw you from a distance
item.description: it’s too early to say that i like you, but i do slightly infatuated over every little thing you say

item.title: scintilla
item.description: you are a living pastiche, every artist would wish they made a mellifluous piece, mozart would have written for a decade

item.title: so bad
item.description: you like boys, i like you there’s this tune i found, reminded me of you you stood in front of me, for what felt like an eternity

item.title: some old poetry i wrote when I was young
someday
item.description: someday adv. [at some time in the future] i. it’s funny how you’re the first one i look for every sunday, wednesday, and thursday.

item.title: Sparemares
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ I tried to sleep, you’re keeping me awake With all your words, to me are fake

item.title: Steven and numbers
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ My name is Steven, and I am seven I don’t like to go to school, to learn what’s odd and even

item.title: the atheist and the believer
item.description: i didn’t say i don’t believe in Him i just don’t believe in human-made religion and i had to shut my mouth when i say oh my God

item.title: The First Day - I Thought
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ Time moves agonizingly slow No right words ought to follow

item.title: The Last Day - I Stopped
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ It’s been too long since our goodbye It’s funny how it went, all reasons why

item.title: then again it's unrequited
item.description: Then I saw you enter the room Shy eyes and glint of boredom Your scent knocking the air out of me

item.title: what your fingers can do
item.description: is there anything you aren’t good at? you pluck my innermost desires like you pluck the strings of your guitar

item.title: When Summer and Autumn Collided
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ An eighteen-day gap on our twin-month birthday You were born Friday, I was on the last Tuesday

item.title: your gorgeous face and 3.3 GPA
item.description: just when i thought you were all just a pretty face i’d open your profile to see your previous grades
